author: Kazeem Awojoodu
title: Priority For Workers', Pensioners' Welfare: CYE Declares Makinde Best Governor In Nigeria Nigeria | Independent Newspaper Nigeria
text: Priority For Workers’, Pensioners’ Welfare: CYE Declares Makinde Best Governor In Nigeria Nigeria The Yoruba socio-cultural group known as Council of Yoruba Elders has commended Oyo state Governor, Engr. Seyi Makinde for prioritising the well-being of the workers and pensioners in the state. YCE in a press statement signed by it’s Secretary General, Dr. Victor Taiwo described Governor Makinde as the best governor in the country. A copy of the press statement made available to Daily INDEPENDENT Newspaper in Ibadan, the Capital City of Oyo State on Monday, declared Engr. Seyi Makinde as the best Governor in the history of Oyo State when it comes to welfare of workers and pensioners. The statement further read as thus; “We witnessed a very strange scenario at our headquarters office in Ibadan yesterday Thursday 28th December, 2023 when a large number of people trooped into our office unannounced.Initially we were frightened by the large number of the strange and unexpected visitors. We asked about their group identity and their mission. According to them, they were representatives of the Oyo State pensioners who were looking for the best way of expressing their gratitude to the government of Engr. Oluseyi Makinde of Oyo State for his unprecedented disposition of magnanimity to both the workers and pensioners of Oyo State for always making them happy and joyous since his inception as the Governor.” “Truly looking at them, one would see joy glowing on their respective faces. According to the selected spokesperson one Mrs. Olojede who burst into tears when recounting the boons the Governor has disposed to them so far, aside that Governor Makinde never for once exceeded 25th of every month to pay both workers and pensioners’ salaries since the day he became the Governor, the regular palliative allowances have never failed. And to cap it all, the 13th month salary has also been disbursed.” “These are unprecedented especially when compared to the ugly situations that operate in some other states where their workers collect one third or half salaries.They had, therefore, come to inform the elders of Yorubaland to help them send their gratitude to the Governor. When we heard this, what occurred to us immediately was to contact the leadership of the pensioners in particular to verify or substantiate this information. Thus, we contacted Comrade Olusegun Abatan, and he has the following to say in corroboration of our visitors’ cause for euphoria and gratitude.” While x-raying the achievements of Governor Makinde in officer as related to workers and pensioners welfare, Dr. Victor Taiwo stated that, “On assumption of office he stopped payment of pensions in percentages for retired primary school teachers. Before then, a month pension was paid in percentages of 40%, 30%, 30% and spread over three months. This resulted into arrears of pensions for teachers alone cumulating into N42.3billion before he took over the mantle of leadership.” “Governor Seyi Makinde pays pensioners their pensions every 25th day of the month just as he pays workers their salaries. He increased payment of gratuities to workers who retired from the Ministries, Departments and Agencies of government in the core State from N100 million to N250 million per month. He has not reneged on the court judgment (NUP took the former administration to court) and has religiously been paying N250 million every month to defray arrears of gratuities owed retired primary school teachers. He gave pensioners palliatives during the Covid pandemic. He gave Oyo State Pensioners N10,000 each last for Christmas turkeys.He has repeated the same feat again today for new year chickens–a thing no Governor did in the whole of the old Western Region and which no Governor in the Federation has done. When other Governors are dithering, Engineer Seyi Makinde has started giving pensioners N15,000 wage/pension award and he will be paying for 6 months. So far pensioners have been paid this award for three months. The wage/pension award is to cushion the effects of the removal of fuel subsidy.” “His Excellency has promised that he will liquidate all arrears of pensions and gratuities owed by previous administrations before the expiration of his tenure in 2027 and a Committee headed by the Deputy Governor had been put in place for that purpose. Further from here, we also visited some of the ministries at the State Secretariat, Agodi where we spoke with some of the Permanent Secretaries who all corroborated the story.” “Thus, our stand at the Council of Yoruba Elders (CYE) is that Governor Makinde should be declared the best Governor in Nigeria if only for his humaneness to the workers and pensioners alike in a state where a previous Governor once called the pensioners dead people.Thus, on behalf of the workers and pensioners of Oyo State, the Council of Yoruba Elders says thank you Mr. Governor. And more feathers to your cap.” The statement concluded.

author: Josh LaBella, Staff Writer
title: New CT state police troopers awarded for saving fellow recruit's life
text:
Connecticut State Police say seven new troopers and two instructors saved the life of a recruit over the summer at the academy in Middletown.
Ned Gerard/Hearst Connecticut Media MIDDLETOWN — Seven new state troopers and two instructors have been awarded for saving a recruit's life last summer, officials say.
Connecticut State Police said trooper trainees Gunner Nunn, Julia Gettings, Justin Trzaski, Kelly Mazza, Lina Vivo, Nicholas Jamaitus and Donnell Niles received awards at their graduation ceremony Thursday for performing life-saving measures on a fellow recruit who collapsed at the Training Academy during the overnight hours last summer.
"After being sworn in as state troopers this morning during their graduation from the State Police Training Academy, the seven recruits, along with two academy instructors, were awarded the Medal for Lifesaving for responding to another recruit who was suffering from a severe medical emergency," police said. "This is believed to be the first time newly sworn CT state troopers were awarded medals at their graduation."
Police said the two instructors who received awards were Trooper First Class Donald Dunning and Sgt. Jason St. John.
On Aug. 18, police said, a female recruit suffered a medical emergency during the early-morning hours. Police said her two roommates rendered urgent care before other recruits, some with extensive medal training, arrived to assist. They said their rapid response and their assistance with arriving emergency medical personnel is commendable, adding they were only in their ninth week of the 28-week academy.
"After providing immediate emergency medical care on site, academy staff and recruits coordinated ambulatory transport to Midstate Medical Center in Meriden and communication with the family of the recruit," they said. "Doctors and staff at Midstate (Medical Center) quickly determined that the recruit in medical distress required urgent treatment from a facility with a higher level of care. However, severe thunderstorms prevented transport by helicopter."
Police said the ambulance that arrived to transport the recruit to Yale-New Haven Hospital struggled to navigate through heavy traffic because of the bad weather during rush hour, so academy staff cleared a path of travel and escorted it with emergency lights and sirens.

They said Yale medical staff and the recruit's family directly attributed the patient's survival to the response of academy staff and recruits.
"At a time of crisis, the support demonstrated by the staff and recruits during and after the incident displayed professionalism and care that went above and beyond expectations," they said.

title: The key Code To Merlot Tasting. Yours, At no cost… Really
text:
Merlot, one of the most popular red wines in the world, is a varieties of wine grape that originated in Bordeaux, France. Celebrated for its plum, blackberry, and black cherry flavors, Merlot is a beloved wine among wine enthusiasts and newcomers alike. In this article, we will delve into the history of Merlot, its characteristics, and how to celebrate this velvety smooth red wine.
History of Merlot
Merlot’s history dates back to the 18th century in Bordeaux, France. The name “Merlot” is derived from the French word “merle,” meaning blackbird, which is a nod to the dark color of the grape. Initially, Merlot was used as a blending grape to add softness and fruitiness to Bordeaux wines. However, in the 20th century, Merlot began to gain popularity as a standalone varietal. Today, Merlot is grown in many regions around the world, including Italy, California, Chile, and Australia.
Characteristics of Merlot
Merlot is known for its approachable and fruit-forward taste profile. The wine typically exhibits flavors of plum, blackberry, black cherry, and hints of chocolate and coffee. Merlot’s tannins are generally softer than those found in other red wines, making it a perfect choice for International Merlot Day those who prefer a smoother wine. The wine’s acidity is moderate, which helps to balance out the fruit flavors.
Merlot’s versatility is another reason for its popularity. It can be enjoyed on its own or paired with a variety of dishes, including red meat, pasta, pizza, and cheese. The wine’s soft tannins also make it an excellent choice for those who are new to red wine.
How to Celebrate Merlot
Celebrating Merlot can be as simple or as elaborate as you like. Here are some ideas to get you started:
Merlot Tasting : Gather a group of friends and host a Merlot tasting event. Select a few different Merlot wines from various regions and compare their flavor profiles. Pairing Party : Pair Merlot with a variety of dishes, such as grilled meats, pasta, and cheese. Experiment with different pairing combinations to find your favorite. Wine and Cheese Night : Invite friends over for a wine and cheese night. Select a few different Merlot wines and pair them with a variety of artisanal cheeses. Merlot and Chocolate : Indulge in a sweet and savory pairing by pairing Merlot with dark chocolate. The rich flavors of the wine and chocolate complement each other perfectly. International Merlot Day : Celebrate International Merlot Day on November 7th by hosting a Merlot-themed party. Decorate with a Bordeaux-inspired setting, and serve a variety of Merlot wines. Food Pairing Ideas
Merlot’s versatility makes it an excellent choice for pairing with a variety of dishes. Here are some food pairing ideas to get you started:
Grilled Steak : Merlot’s plum and blackberry flavors complement the charred, savory flavors of a grilled steak.
Pasta with Tomato Sauce : Merlot’s acidity helps to cut through the richness of the pasta and tomato sauce.
Pizza Night : Merlot pairs perfectly with the savory flavors of pizza, especially when topped with meats or mushrooms.
Cheese and Charcuterie : Merlot’s fruit flavors complement the richness of cheese and charcuterie.
Conclusion
Merlot is a wine that deserves to be celebrated. With its smooth, fruit-forward flavor profile, it’s no wonder why it’s a favorite among wine enthusiasts. Whether you’re a seasoned wine drinker or just starting out, Merlot is an excellent choice. So the next time you’re planning a wine-themed event, consider celebrating Merlot. With its versatility and approachable taste profile, it’s sure to be a hit with your guests.
